Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different types of plants, showing which ones receive water and which ones do not.
The student can illustrate how plants appear when they have enough light compared to when they do not.
The student can identify and depict patterns in plant growth based on the availability of light and water.
The student can indicate through their drawing that plants need both light and water to live and grow.
The student can use their illustration to show how the absence of water affects plants, such as showing wilting or browning.
The student can depict the effects of the absence of light on plants, such as showing yellowing or slowed growth.
